result.execSummary:
The defendant Niccole J. Spade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: Seek and obtain full time employment consistent with health needs.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample on 10-19-16
DNA surcharge remitted.
Fine & costs remitted.

No contact with victim without prior agent approval.
No contact with co-defendant without prior agent approval.

Take parenting class and any other supportive classes.
Take financial literacy class.
Must comply with all terms and conditions of CHIPS order.
AODA evaluation and follow through treatment as recommended by agent.
Participate in mental health counseling assessment and evaluation including treatment to deal with sexual assault and any other counseling as recommended by agent.
All other conditions as recommended by agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
